note.p: Education: Jesuits' College, Douai; St George's Hospital, London

Career: Staff Surgeon, Duke of York's Hospital, Chelsea (for 12 years); Surgeon, National Vaccine Institution; taught anatomy; lecturer (until 1832); interested in medical electricity; died after being "much shaken" by an accident on the recently-opened South Western Railway
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1846 No 66 pp 638-639
